intro: Rhaphithamnus myrtifolius, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved rhaphithamnus, is a shrub native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a whitish bloom, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by small, fleshy berries. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
